commit.message:
Fix a crash when a summoner accepts a Gozag bribe

If an out of view summoner summons some monsters and then you move so
that the summoner and its summons come into view at the same time, we
would iterate over all the monsters that just come into view and call
`seen_monster` on them. If this call to `seen_monster` caused the
summoner to accept a Gozag bribe and become friendly, its summons would
be killed but we would still call `seen_monster` on these dead summons
resulting in a crash.
Fix acidic and icy floors not using tile variations

Reset lua state properly for objstat/mapstat

Similar to d744bac7, we now reset lua states and subsequently reload the
necessary data after each iteration. This fixes a problem where large
objstat jobs (e.g. 1000 iterations of generating all of the Dungeon
branch) eventually error repeatedly in zonify layout code. The precise
reason for this hasn't been fully debugged, but it seems to be related
to available lua memory. For now, it's wise to follow the same close ->
reinitialize procedure as we do for the main game loop in each
objstat/mapstat iteration.

Testing has shown that this reset doesn't significantly impact objstat
performance. In the future, when I rework game loop lua reinitializaiton
to more carefully reset and load only the necessary data, we can revisit
needed to close and reopen the lua state for all game modes.

Adjust morphogenic ooze slimification accumulation

While the original af_slimify timing was roughly based off of bat cloud
drowinsess numbers, clouds are much more consistent at applying their
effects than attack brands are in combat. It's very plausible to be killed
by a morphogenic ooze band well before one actually gets slimified in the
first place, due to each turn where an ooze fails to hit allows one to
work off the effect build-up without really bothering with any
counterplay, since each hit only applies 35-45 aut of a status that needs
to reach 100 to activate that also goes down 10 each turn. Rather than
making them apply the status in one or two hits entirely, I am doubling
the status application and threshold numbers both, which thus halves the
rate the status wears off mid-fight. As rare monsters with a singular
gimmick far less instantly lethal than other summoning or conjurations
mechanics added to the branch this version, we might as well test a
version of the monster with a functional version of the gimmick first.

(This commit also adjusts the colour schema of DUR_SLIMIFYING to reduce
the ambiguity of going across multiple shades of magenta. No save-compat
code has been included with this commit, as there is rather little benefit
in tactically converting an older save mid-fight to try and prevent
slimification against exactly one encounter. I am also fixing a notable
bug where one could cancel jelly form immediately after actually getting
it, which I hope hasn't been distorting the testing of the monster
entirely....)

Yet further small tiles adjustments

 * Azure jellies and colossal amoeba have had their colours and brightness
   adjusted away from each other, to help with those with poor eyesight
   and poor pixel miscaling confusing the two very different blue jellies
   in Slime.

 * Antimagic Gaze no longer accidentally uses the Draining Gaze tile
   animation flash, as was introduced in 6213b69.

 * The Draining Gaze animation flash from eyes of draining now lasts
   very slightly longer when it targets players, and now also lasts
   increasingly longer the more the player is drained overall.

 * Fannar and player doll broad axes have had their palettes simplified.

 * Rapier and broad axe randarts now have unique player doll tiles,
   based off of roctavian's good_item rapiers and broad axe doll tiles.
Checkwhite

Fix a crash when abandoning Gozag

If you had a item from one of Gozag's shops on your shopping list and it
wasn't the last item on the list, abandoning Gozag would crash. This was
caused by iterating over the items in your shopping list while removing
any that were from Gozag stuffing up the iteration.

This change also fixes a bug where abandoning Gozag would remove
shopping list items from shops that weren't from Gozag if the shop was
covered with temporary terrain.

Fix temporary terrain expiring making mimics into real features

If you covered a feature mimic (such as a shop) in temporary terrain
(such as the lava from hell fire mortar), when the temporary terrain
expired the feature would now be real rather than a mimic (e.g. you
could now move onto and shop at what used to be a shop mimic).

Also don't allow a feature mimic to disappear when covered with
temporary terrain as this would result in the mimic becoming real rather
than disappearing if the temporary terrain wasn't a mimicable feature
(e.g. shallow water from a water nymph).

Fix wizmode placed shop and trap mimics not being mimics

The code for placing features was returning early for shops and traps
making it skip turning the placed feature into a mimic when ask to place
one.

Fix env.shop becoming filled with useless shops

When loading a level that had already been generated, all shops on the
level would be inserted into env.shop. However, shops from the previous
level would never be cleared (although shops with the same position
would be overridden). Generating a new level would clear env.shop
however. These extra shops weren't accessible to the player as there
weren't any entrances to them on the map.

Don't leak memory when adding an item to the shopping list

We were allocated a `CrawlHashTable` using `new` and then using it to
construct a `CrawlStoreValue`. However, `CrawlStoreValue`'s constructor
does not take ownership of the `CrawlHashTable` it takes as an argument
(but rather makes a copy).

Changelog update through f52bb6b

Mostly to catch the last few talisman and spell changes this version.
Copy-editing support provided by DracoOmega.

Fix a lua error (knorpule3001)

For regret_index_shop_air, add a missing string concatenation.

Fix the enter key on TV devices

Android TV devices remap the enter key in hardware keyboards as the
D-Pad center (OK) button. That event is ignored by Crawl, so we are
doing the opposite remap here.
Fix darby_harvest_season (PsiRedEye22)

Fix partisan and trident doll displays

bf00e41's copy-pastes accidentally assigned the partisan randart paper
doll tile to tridents. While fixing this, I've also noticed that trident
randarts have never had their own paper doll rendition seperating them
from non-mundane tridents, and thus also added a new paper doll tile
modifying roctavian's non-mundane trident that should properly reflect
the appearance of roctavian's randart tridents.

(There's... a lot of other weapons that evidently have never haad proper
randart paper doll tiles, which I will investigate into and make more
tiles to handle before the version release.)
Fix a typo (Undo)

Quick scraped-together vault review

Of note:

 * zot_entry_small once more no longer places on Depths:$, as was screwed
   up by eee5569 automating zot entry set-up.

 * minmay_fire_ice_demons no longer places item rewards when it spawns in
   Cocytus or Gehenna.

 * grunt_twist_and_shout no longer accidentally places pointless runed
   doors.

 * The D:1-2 polyominoes now use a non-default rock tile so they stand out
   even slightly as highly abstract objects versus the rest of early
   Dungeon rock wall generation.

Couple of small altar vaults (#4998)

Adds a sealed altar containing a non-temple god that requires consumables
to access, and a zin overflow that also places a [sometimes non-overflow]
chaotic god altar with themed monsters sealed behind a runed door.

[Committer's notes: Tweaked the god altar weightings for the former vault
to reflect how rare they overall should be available. Heavily adjusted
the latter vault to scale substantially more with depth rather than just
throwing slime creatures on D:3 at newcomers, completely revised the
visuals to both emphasize Zin sealing the god and to use tiles customized
per-god rather than using Tartarus stone for Jiyva and Lugonu, and adjusted
the weight of both the vault and its chance to just roll Xom over Jiyva
and Lugonu so it doesn't have to be hyper-rare in its placement.

Closes #4998.]

Tweak worldbinder summons once more

When ugly things and very ugly things stopped spawning in V as of f517b90,
worldbinder summons weren't adjusted in exchange, so they still declared
themselves summoning ugly things from the Vaults. As V-convoking
worldbinders are still notably the strongest of worldbinders despite the
removal of thunderhulks from their list in 3be09a1, this could still do
with further adjustments.

Worldbinders summoning from The Vaults now get polterguardians and
ironbound preservers, rather than very ugly things and ironbound
frosthearts. This should be reasonably distinct for a summoner's summons
even more directly helping its own summoner's lifespan, and not feature
quite as much spikes of resist checkecs as the previous ones.

Meanwhile, I'm also trading away the Shoals' set's manticores and merfolk
aquamancers for merfolk sirens and water nymphs, which should be less
boring as support monsters compared to the projectile conjuration effects
struggling to entirely function in the Abyss's terrain pressures. Both of
these have some of the worst-performing worldbinder summons in terms of
kill stats (and aquamancers also feel pretty high tier in their own
branch), so this should continue to nudge the total worldbinder threat
pools closer together.

One last balance adjustment for Protean Grace for now

Experimentation with Protean Grace's state after ad136e9 has left it off
in too weak a state to be of much interest for the average non-Xom
non-Jiyva character, as the testing of #4949 demonstrated. While we do
have a fair number of other interesting top-tier mutations available,
there are still further potential iterations of the mutation possible
that can continue to try to handle the vast gap of plausible mutation
counts provided by the mutation gods.

This commit's approach is quite bluntly direct in this intent: protean
grace now no longer has scales to every two mutations as both of the
previous states did, but it also now is hard capped to not provide any
further than +7 Slay and EV+7, and it no longer counts itself. This should
still provide a bit of a tangible edge to rolling it with only a few
mutations or getting past the soft cap ceiling via mutation gods, while
still preventing the mutation gods from having a mutation that just flatly
provides +10 to +20 double stat benefits.

allow death cobs into klown kollege (#5039)

since 3440744 harlequin's traps no longer override the attack flavor

[Committer's notes: Sure, why not. Closes #5039.]

Fix recreating a automapped level leaving blank tiles

This was due to call to `tile_new_level` in `wizard_recreate_level`
setting all the tiles in the tile cache to TILE_DNGN_UNSEEN after the
call to `load_level`. However, this call to `tile_new_level` isn't even
needed anymore as commit ef9621c added a call to it to `load_level`
(Technically the functions were `TileNewLevel` and `load` back then).
The call to `tile_new_level` in `load_level` happens before automapping
the level so it doesn't cause this problem.

Fix wizmode traveling to automapped level leaving blank tiles

When wizmode traveling to a automapped level (such as nocropolis) that
you hadn't previously visited, all out of view tiles would appear
completely blank until you saw them or reloaded the game. This was
caused by a call to `tile_new_level` after the call to `load_level`
in `_wizard_go_to_level` setting all the tiles in the tile cache to
TILE_DNGN_UNSEEN. This call to `tile_new_level` isn't even needed
anymore as commit ef9621c added a call to it to `load_level`
(Technically the functions were `TileNewLevel` and `load` back then).
The call to `tile_new_level` in `load_level` happens before automapping
the level so it doesn't cause this problem.

Fix some vaults not getting the colour tile they specified

If a vault specified a floor or rock wall tile name with no colour e.g.
floor_rough it would get that tile in the colour used by console for
floors or rock walls. If it specified a tile with a colour e.g.
floor_rough_blue it would get the tile in the colour specified. This
let us use the console colour for tiles with animated colours as these
can't be specified directly (e.g. there is no floor_rough_etc_random for
a random animated colour) while still letting tiles use a different
colour from console when it looks better.

However, some coloured tiles are just aliases for the non-coloured
version e.g. floor_rough_red is an alias for floor_rough so if a vault
specified a floor as having the tile floor_rough_red it would actually
get the tile floor_rough in whatever colour console used for floors.

To fix this, only apply animated console colours to floor and rock wall
tiles. This is actually what we did prier to commit 6dfb6d6 but it was
lost in the rework.

Basic Android TV Support

Here I'm trying to meet the requirements for the game to be distributed
as a TV app. Most of the code is to make the launcher usable with a TV
remote. The game is not playable without an external keyboard or pointer
device, but the user is warned about it. I hope it will be enough.

Other changes:
- Improved virtual D-Pad. Now it can be used to navegate menus.
- Keys in the transparent keyboard are highlighted when pressed.
- Virtual keyboard disabled by default in TV and PC devices.

Minor vault tile edits

Matches a couple of cases of unintended FTILE assignment with the
surrounding floor, and makes the rug in darby_raucous_goblin_parties
red in console so it will display as red in tiles, as was changed in
6dfb6d6.

Some lingering 0.34 tile clean-up work

 * Spore form now properly depicts fungus taking up the lower half or
   feet of various bodies, as was missed in the original implementation of
   providing such tiles in 31b8f63 due to confusion over other parts of
   the concept. This also adds additional tiles for naga, armataur,
   and djinn all avoiding the barding-slot area for the former two.

 * Dragon-coil talismans now have shadows (for e.g. Shoals), as was
   accidentally left out of providing the new tile in c257eed.

 * The hive-form felid tile has now been flipped to match other felid
   transformation tiles.

 * The werewolf felid tile now uses part of LemurRobot's vampire felid
   tile, as the head from Denzi's cats had poor proportions in comparison.

 * Orbs of mayhem now use the frenzied icon from eedf646 instead of the
   droplet of blood that e.g. vampric weapons use.

 * I've adjusted ontoclasm's Death's Door icon to actually bleed past the
   spell icon frame to match the other level 9 spells doing the same, as
   was neglected back in 8d63b16.

 * Monster Deflect Missiles now once more uses ontoclasm's old Deflect
   Missiles icon, to both reflect the older use of the name and to have a
   somewhat more dramatic icon for a now stronger effect.

 * Planar Overlay now has a new tile made from ontoclasm's Passage of
   Golubria tile instead of just directly using that same tile.

 * The plainest of the Depths stone wall tiles now has slightly more
   decoration on it to help it match more with the rest of its set.

 * Detected decorative floor tiles use a less bright lower-contrast tile
   to be less gaudy when detecting them in large masses (e.g. with the
   current arrangement for weapon-inlaid floor in Elf:2's Hall of Blades).

A batch of Darby's vaults

Sixteen neat vaults (plus subvaults) reflecting some repeated vault
desires: vaults with heavy theme components that can spawn in multiple
branches, vaults that focus on deploying newer monsters, and vaults that
can place pre-Lair or earlier to add more interest to the ever-pressured
earlygame.

Alterations past the initial feedback phase for this submission included:
 * some reduced weights for early uses of wall mimics (that autoexplore
   and autopickup will activated anyway) or other aggressive gimmicks,
 * more D monster scaling and general item reward scaling versus depth,
 * syntax adjustments to continue pushing my vault header house style.

Additionally, this comes with support for some decorative floor options
from tiles added in 76a730d not then integrated into other vaults- a
djembe set, a now somewhat-Yred-flavoured flag, and a pike with impaled
skulls. These aren't getting a lot of distribution quite yet (between
the impending feature freeze and their narrowed flavour), but the lua and
descriptions have been set up for these vaults, with the write-ups also
mostly written by Darby.

Fix a failing test

Since b9c0c7a the previous example used would fail.

In theory, these body slot mutations are supposed to be able to trade off
with each other when forced, but this seems to have not been the case for
all the other ones for many years now (and correcting this while still
preventing the situation fixed by b9c0c7a is non-trivial, nor is it clear
that it is more interesting gameplay to be able to randomly swap your foot
mutation for an almost-identical one anyway).

In the meantime, pick a different pair of mutations that do satisfy this
test's intent.

Mention that draconians cannot wear helmets in-game

In the same place as their other armour restrictions.

This closes #3012
Explicate that the Reckless mutation only affects melee weapons (dilly)

Don't frenzy protected allies with an orb of Mayhem (Szymekc)

Allies that can't be affected by any player AoE (eg: player shadows,
ancestors) probably shouldn't be affected by this either.

This incidentally stops a crash with attacking your own frenzied shadow.
If another shadow attack triggered on this attack, your old shadow would
be destroyed before your new shadow tried to hit it, resulting in it
hitting a reset monster.

Don't allow making multiple vampire thralls at once

If a vampire-form player stabbed multiple monsters to death at the same
time (eg: using WJC whirlwind), all of them would rise as thralls instead
of just one.

Now we test 'reviving' monsters when looking for thralls as well.

This fixes #5014

Don't grow burstshrooms when hitting firewood or allies

This isn't quite as harmful to be able to farm off allies as a bunch of
other attack triggers, but it feels more consistent with general policy.
Properly prevent Orb of Stardust from working on djinni

Correct the Evoke Invisibility description (Necromancer23)

It hasn't given contam since dccffc7.

Prevent having hooves and talons at the same time (Speedwagon)

This was rarely possible in specific circumstances. I think it required
some temporary levels of hooves and some permanent ones at the same time,
leading to some code thinking it had removed the hooves to allow the talons
to grow in their place (but instead the innate levels remained).

It turns out the reason this doesn't happen for other body slot mutations
is their presence in this _body_facets array. I think this also means that
them being opposed pairs in mut_conflicts may be redundant (or at least not
entirely working as intended). But diving into that would be more quite a
bit more involved at present.
Fix a few redundant artprops being able to generate on talismans

Allow spellmotor to benefit from aqua form's reaching

This fixes #5042

Fix crumbled stairs not redrawing properly in descent mode

We were using `force_show_update_at` followed by `view_update_at` to
redraw a square after crumbling its staircase. The call to
`force_show_update_at` isn't needed any more as staircase peaking will
have marked the square is known causing `view_update_at` to call it for
us. `view_update_at` will update the map knowledge for the square,
however, we have already updated the map knowledge of what feature is
present and do not wish to update the player's knowledge of monsters and
clouds etc. `view_update_at` also shouldn't be called for squares out of
sight and will trigger player in LOS events for the square as well as
sometimes incorrectly updating the map knowledge. It also only redraws
the foreground layer in local tiles and the old staircase and new floor
that has replaced it are both drawn in the background layer. Instead use
`redraw_view_at` to redraw the square.

Fix krakens not being immune to drowning

This was broken when the habitat of krakens was changed from HT_WATER
(with special cases to keep them in deep water) to HT_DEEP_WATER.

Fix up stairs not always crumbling in descent mode

When you went down a staircase in descent mode and covered the up
staircase with temporary terrain (such as by casting noxius bog), the up
staircase wouldn't be destroyed and would reappear when the temporary
terrain expired.

Fix shops not always closing when leaving Gozag

If a Gozag created shop is covered with temporary terrain such as the
lava from hell fire mortar when you abandon Gozag, the temporary terrain
will be changed into a closed shop but will be changed back into an open
shop when the temporary terrain expires. Instead, don't change the
temporary terrain but rather when it reverts back make sure it reverts
to a closed shop.

Fix fortress crab's interaction with +MP artefacts (Lici)

The player's max MP wasn't properly updating when entering/leaving fortress crab
form while wearing artefact body armour with +MP on it.

Allow fortress crab to double intrinsic properties of dragon armour (Lici)

Resists from dragon armour were internally handled in a way that was
neither an ego nor an artprop, and thus didn't get affected by fortress
crab. Now, we automatically map (most of) those intrinsics to the
artprop cache and do not check them in any other way. This slightly
simplifies some code and allows them to interact properly with fortress
crab.

(Regen from troll leather is still handled somewhat differently - as all
regen items are - and steam resist has no artprop equivalent. Though this
latter case also doesn't matter here, since doubling it wouldn't do
anything, anyway.)

In future, this sort of procedure could also be extended to intrinsic
resists from enhancer staves or even jewellery.
Fix the console build

Fix leaving Gozag not always redrawing shops that close

We were using `view_update_at` to update the map knowledge and redraw a
shop after closing it. However, it only redraws the foreground in local
tiles (shops are drawn in the background layer), it only properly
updates map knowledge for squares in LOS and it updates more than just
the map knowledge of the shop (e.g. it also updates monster knowledge).
Not redrawing the shop tile often wasn't noticeable as we update the
shopping list which will cause levels excursions which redraw the whole
level if it has any items on it. Instead update only the map knowledge
of what shop is on the square and then redraw the square.

Don't crash when attacking a banished enemy in spore form

Distortion banish resets an enemy before it reaches this point, resulting
in an assert when we try to check their unbreathing status.

This does mean you also don't get any mushrooms for attacking an enemy on
an attack that banishes them, which is mildly unfortunate, but probably not
that big a deal (and their position is already reset, so it would require
additional special handling to work).

Fix missing spore form status display on % (Rypofalem)

This closes #5041 (but I opted to do it without redundantly specifying the
default string)

Fix digging's targeter leaking terrain changes

If you had seen a diggable wall and then moved so that it wasn't in
sight anymore and then a monster dug through the wall but still left the
wall out of your sight, digging's targeter would give the square the
highlighting for a floor square leaking the out of sight terrain change.

Fix an appearance of the currently-retired Sword of Power (Lici)

When the Sword of Power was removed in 6326a8a for overlap with the Valour
brand in 5a1e93a, the vault minmay_guarded_unrand_sword_of_power was
missed due to our legacy standard of unrands all being listed with
underscores. (It would just function as a +9 great sword of valour and
be replaced with such on loading up a save, anyway). There's a little bit
of dev interest in keeping around the ancient name due to the inheritance
of it from pre-Stone-Soup, so rather than remove the vault entirely, the
vault just gets a highly-enchanted randart great sword of valour instead of
making the removed unrand.

docs: Update spell library help screen to recommend Tab

Notably, ! is still left as an alternative to Tab for forward cycling.
Also, Shift-Tab's functionality is now spelled out.

[Committer's note: slightly tweaked wording.]

docs: Recommend Tab instead of ! for spell library navigation

While ! makes perfect sense to recommend here (the spell library is
normally accessed via `M`, requiring shift for most players), its main
flaw is that it can only navigate the spell library forwards (i.e. to
the right). The Tab key performs the same function as ! here, but does
not require shift -- even more critically, Shift+Tab will navigate the
spell library backwards. Along with being slightly more conveniently
placed than !, the Tab key may encourage more active use of hiding and
showing spells, as well as the auto_hide_spells option.

Fix some issues with invalid pet_target and allies

Previously, if the player's pet_target was set to a monster that was, for
some reason, no longer a valid target for your allies (often due to being
out of LoS, but potentially for several other reasons), we would still set
is as their foe and then later on reset their foe to MHITNOT.

This manifested in a couple of negative ways. Running from a fight with a
dead ancestor could make the ancestor respawn wandering (since it is trying
to fight a now-distant monster and cannot) and newly-summoned allies would
sometimes stand around doing nothing if you had a 'leftover' pet target
from a previous battle.

Now we test pet_target validity before assining it to allies. In cases
where the pet_target is invalid for them, we use the same auto-targeting
behavior we would use if there was no pet_target at all (ie: engage the
nearest visible enemy).

[Commiter's note: restructured some logic to be more consistent with
typical DCSS formatting, put in a check for a possible array out-of-bounds
and rewrote the commit message/name for clarity.]

Slightly improve pathfinding code regarding doors

Respect traverse_doors = false when pathfinding without an explicit
monster.

De-duplicate some logic in mons_is_traversable.

[Committer's note: This commit was originally intended to fix an issue that
was fixed differently by 6ed2157, but it still seemed to provide a few
minor improvements, so I rewrote the commit message for the present
context.]

Stop stationary monsters pathfinding

This is causing a bug where you can't rest behind a translucent wall
from a stationary monster.

Fix mouse clicks sometimes not working for Yes/No prompts on local tiles

A bug was causing mouse clicks on yes/no popups to be ignored on Windows.
Root cause: negative mouse keycodes (for example CK_MOUSE_B1 == -9997) were
sometimes passed to C library character functions (such as
isalpha/toupper). Those functions are defined only for EOF or values
representable as unsigned char; passing negative non-EOF values invokes
undefined behaviour and corrupted the prompt logic. The fix replaces use of
the C library character test with the projects ASCII-only helper
isaalpha() when checking popup input. Using isaalpha() avoids invoking
undefined behaviour on negative keycodes and ensures mouse clicks are
correctly accepted.

This change only replaces the character test; no other logic was changed.

This hopefully fixes #4968, fixes #4590, fixes #4090, and fixes #3074

[Committer's note: included PR description into the commit message and
noted issue fixes. I hadn't been able to reproduce the original bug on my
end, but the logic seems sound, so I'm keeping my fingers crossed.]

Fix walking scroll skill display in talisman preview (Zigmound)

Also commonise the skill bonus between the preview and the actual bump.

Fix display for sphinx form airstrike damage (Zigmound)

This was missed in 15d368e.

Make revelation reveal most squares exactly.

This removes aliasing from features such as floors, walls, water,
statues, and fountains, which previously showed as base types when
mapped.

The aliasing wasn't really doing much - vaults are already often quite
identifiable from shapes. Magic mapped levels now look prettier, and we
don't tell small lies to players.

Altars and portals are still mapped to UNKNOWN_ALTAR and
UNKNOWN_PORTAL, because running after unknown altars and portals is
fun.

Small consequences:
- Exclusions placed in unseen terrain now respect the opacity of that
terrain, since we know it from mapping.
- Digging targeters now know whether mapped squares are diggable,
fixing #4509.
- We note any notable features when we map them, if the aliased
feature is notable. This includes orb statues revealing the orb enemy.

fix: Usk grand finale on wall creatures crash

Don't let the player target creatures inside of walls!

[Committer's note: made the wording of the error printed if you try this a
little more explicit]

Correctly set tile flavours with multiple terrain changes

This fixes a bug whereby reverting one of a stack of terrain changes
would show the flavour of the base tile. For example:
- Cast bog in shoals, covering an upstair (which has a flavour tile).
- Have a water nymph cover the upstair tile.
- Kill the nymph

This would display a stairs tile (but not allow the player to go up it)

Fix a bolt of flesh redirection crash

When firing a Zykzyl bolt of flesh with Ru redirection or Dith's
Marionette, we would sometimes crash. This is because the tracer beam
for the attack is aimed at the Zykzyl itself, and the beam sets
stop_at_allies. This causes us to attempt to regress a ray with no
position or direction, which does not work.

We fix this by not regressing self-aimed rays when stop_at_allies is
set.

Quickset skill target to maximum skill on talismans

Allow (s) to set a skill target to the max skill, if we are above the
min skill

Don't place a shaft vault at branch ends

For billiards_dpeg, its theme requires the shaft traps, so just prevent
it placing at the end of Dungeon or Elf. This was found via objstat
error messaging.
Fix spore form burstrooms not functioning with Oka/Sac Love

Fix the build on CAO

The gcc on CAO can't find a template match for the sort function's
lambda if the lambda's arguments aren't const.

Fix Dith shadow mimic crashing on launcher attacks

65ca641 fixing this for some throwing weapons instead broke it for all
launchers. Oops.

Fix a couple vampire form issues

Bat swarm stopped unmelding your gear upon ending since the transformation
was made cancellable in 896e69c (rather to my surprise).

Also using bat swarm at very low shapeshifting skill could cause a
divide-by-zero error.

This closes #5037
Fix eel hands mutation description (Lici)

Remove the old Blade status description

It is unused as the new Blade status description later in the file is
overriding it.

Remove duplicated -Cast description

-Cast in Status.txt is duplicated, so one should be removed.

Don't delete tentacles on terrain change

Friendly and unfriendly tentacles were completely destroyed by any
change to the terrain underneath them. For example, eldritch tentacles
could be deleted by casting hellfire mortar at any segment, or Summon
Forest when the generated pool touched the tentacle.

We fix this by only deleting tentacles when finalizing movement in the
case that the monster has actually moved.

Remove the _find_erase function

It used to return true when it erased an element and false when the
element didn't exist. However, its return value is no longer used after
commit fd489b4 so we can just use the erase method instead.

Don't re-enter shops after they reappear (Flugkiller)

When a shop was covered by a temporary terrain change, it
was marked as unnoticed when it came back, and therefore
reentered.

This was happening because even though temporary changes
don't call unnotice_feature, their reversions do.

We fix this by making unnotice_feature only work on features
which are present (which was already the case for stairs), and
fixing the one caller of this who changed features before
unnoticing them.

Also make a function with an unused return type void.

fix: Blade-form status text (Undo)

It was simply "hands" (or whatever similar limbs you possessed). Now it
defaults to "blade-form" since eels are the hands-replacer now.
Fix monster hellfire mortar giving the player a cooldown (Planckenstein)
Correct protean talisman description

Fix a shadow mimic crash with throwing darts (Odds, Rypofalem)

Dith shadow mimic isn't supposed to mimic throws of darts or throwing nets,
but if the player threw the very last of a stack of darts or throwing nets,
the item would have lost its type information by the time the shadow would
try to act, resulting in the shadow attempting to throw a non-misile (and
crashing).

Now, we check and save the missile type *before* shooting instead.

Fix tile picking for floor and rock wall tiles

We were picking the first variant of the tile less often than we should.
Also in halos around shops in bazaars, the floors tiles that were
supposed to use the first variant were instead using a random variant.

Fix bailey wall tiles being red

Bailey rock wall tiles aren't supposed to be the same colour as what
console uses for rock walls. However, an oversight in commit 6dfb6d6
made them use the same colour.

Vault review, mostly 0.34 Troves and talismans edition

 * With slightly more talisman variety provided this version and the
   continued delays on much further Shapeshifting reworks that'd permit
   more divine support for talisman distribution, the unique-per-vault
   Lair end talisman chance has been nudged up from 10% to 12.5%. The
   Bailey fortress talisman chance remains 10%, but also gets a 5% chance
   to place blade talismans as well (as are now weapon skill agnostic).

 * Some talismans distributed by tier have been juggled around to
   accomodate the new eel and spore talismans plus the blade talisman
   nudge upwards. The talismans have also been distributed around a
   small bit, with spore talismans in particular leaning a bit towards
   decorative fungus vaults with the lack of general plant enemies
   earlier on, and eel talismans unsurprisingly placing in water heavy
   vaults.

 * A ranged weapons check has been added to troves to deal with various
   brands (like spectral and reaping) being incompatible with those
   weapons. As such, for characters with more ranged weapons skill than
   any other weapon skill, Eringya's Secret Bog provides longbows (as are
   loosely appropriate for that wooded marsh) and The Dread Knight's
   Derelict Chapel simply just focuses on draining ranged weapons.

 * Rutra's Hidden Sanctum (the Hexes and Stealth trove) no longer
   generates for characters who have less than 1 Stealth skill.

 * Other Trove item improvements include providing troll leather armour
   randarts whenever one would previously get normal leather randarts,
   one more spell in each book, slightly more manuals than previously,
   some slightly higher consumable stacks for many different items,
   enhancer auxes properly managed fore the The Name-Rending Infernalists'
   Reservoir and Ozocubu's Refridgerator, more Strength n randarts in
   Leda's Sunken Stockpile, and slightly higher odds to get the Octopus
   King's Garden as is the main jewellery trove.

 * I've fit in a single new custom shop vault, finally providing an
   air-themed shop to parallel the earth-themed shop added 13 years ago,
   also meant to help slightly increase the amount of eel talismans
   available per game.

 * wall_brick_lightred has had its colours slightly tweaked down towards
   reasonability while it is currently buggily in Bailies, just in case
   it ends up being used in other vaults anyway.
Fix a typo (Autarch)

Forbid Bane of Multiplicity from cloning certain doom sources

I hesitated on this one a few times in past, but Multiplicity already
doesn't clone uniques due to their outsized danger level, and it was a
rather unfortunate high-roll when Multiplicity given by a raven or orb of
entropy immediately made more of them, creating this wildly spiralling doom
train.

(Other sources of doom by monsters I didn't think were significant enough
to be included in this restriction.)

Fix burstshrooms taking longer to explode, the faster you are (Lici)

I have no idea how I ended up coding it this way, but the timer was being
decremented by the length of the player's last action, but on each
normal-speed monster turn (meaning you could quadruple the timer by using
something like a speed rapier compared to waiting in place).

Fix blade form parrying description

(The property mentioned never made it to trunk at all.)
Fix webtiles build

Mildly nerf Cassandra's death ambush

Make only the first monster placed be drawn from a slightly deeper floor
(instead of all of them) and also fix a bug that resulted in creating one
more monster than was intended.

Mildly buff orbs of entropy

They have overall been lagging a little behind the other orb types, so this
nudges their acid ball damage from 3d35 to 3d38 and increases the average
Doom inflicted by their Ill Omen by 18.

(Other monsters using these spells should be unaffected.)

Rename Amulets of Alchemy to Amulets of Chemistry and buff

These were always intended to provide a viable alternative to amulets of
Magic Regeneration, even if the caster wasn't specifically benefitting from
the alchemy enhancer, but I fear their name may have done them no favors
in that regard; multiple players assumed they weren't supposed to be worth
it unless you were using alchemy spells heavily. On top of that, this
resulted in artrops of Alch and Alch+ meaning somewhat different things,
which wasn't the most intuitive.

In addition to the rename, I've increased the average MP recovery effect by
~50%. (I actually fear this might be a little too good, but given player
response thus-far, it seemed fair to try it.)

Gently buff Concussion brand

While a number of players reported that the brand felt fun to play with,
they also felt the payoff for disrupting your own positioning was a bit
inadequate.

This increases the average ministun by 1 aut and the average wall slam
damage from 25% to 33%.

Buff vampire form

Generally considered to be a little underperforming (even if fun), this
commit adds a new property to help their stealth gameplay in a unique way:
when living/demonic/holy monsters first notice a player in vampire form,
they have a 75% chance to be momentarily dazed - skipping their turn and,
importantly, preventing them from shouting. If they fail a Will check, they
will be dazed for several turns longer.

This improves a vampire's ability to stab (and thus interact with other
parts of their kit) in a way that stealth alone could not - even while some
monsters are aware of you, their bandmates may still be sleeping and ripe
to turn to your side.

In addition, some changes have been made to their Bat Swarm ability:
 -The transformation is no longer uncancellable, so the player can manually
  leave it early in order to stab a monster who has been put to sleep.
  (I deliberately disallowed this in the original design since I felt it
  would make the ability primarily an offensive tool rather than an escape
  option. However, given the XP recharge involved, it may be okay to allow
  this.)
 -The amount of clouds created no longer scales with shapeshifting skill.
  In general, less will be made immediately and they will have a shorter
  duration, but they will be generated more rapidly while remaining in the
  form.
 -The XP cooldown is now shortened by shapeshifting skill (though it is
  somewhat slower at 17 skill than previously).

The chance of performing a vampiric attack while at low health also no
longer scales with shapeshifting skill and is always 66%.

I realize that vampire form already had a lot going on and this introduces
a new mechanic on top of that, but it was hard to figure out what to prune
from it due to how they are all so thematically connected to the identity
of 'being a vampire' or work specifically in combination with each other.
(And several players specifically requested that the thrall mechanics be
kept in any rework of it.) Hopefully it dovetails smoothly enough into the
rest of what the form does that the complexity it adds isn't excessive.

Give sphinx and vampire forms See Invis

All monsters of these types have that (and the vampire species also did,
while it existed). While we aren't obligated to keep parity all of the
time, this seems like a reasonable thing to add.

Allow werewolves to wear helmets and cloaks

The complete melding of aux armour was originally maintained as a reference
to the beast form that it 'replaced'. However, while werewolf is often
reported as fun, it has felt just a little undertuned defensively; this
may be sufficient help.

Buff fortress crab form

Slightly reduce the cost of Breathe Rust and increase the scaling factor of
its AC multiplier (from +135% at max skill to +150%).

In addition, the form now doubles the effectiveness of most egos/artprops
on the body armour (eg: rF+ becomes rF++, Int+6 becomes Int+12). This does
not allow things to stack that would not otherwise, but essentially acts as
if the player had a second copy of it equipped - whatever that would do.

It doesn't do anything for unrand-only effects (which typically rely on a
boolean check for whether the item is equipped and don't have a
'centralized' place to double anything about them - unlike standard
egos/artprops. I'm not convinced the complexity of implementing this on a
item-by-item basis is worth it; this already does plenty of flexible
things.

New protean form: Spore

Replacing Maw's old slot as a tier 2 form obtainable from a protean
talisman, this form transforms one arm into a mass of rapidly-growing
fungus. It melds offhand and boots, gives your melee attacks a 50% chance
to weaken any breathing monster on hit, and also grows a line of 3
burstshrooms directly behind what you hit. These burstshrooms are
stationary monsters with relatively low HP, but if allowed to live for
several turns, self-destruct in a burst of spores that deals moderate
damage and has a small chance of dazing enemies hit (and ignores allies
entirely).

They provides a multi-purpose tool which can be used as both an
obstruction and a damage source, in the proper terrain, potentially
splitting bands apart and delaying enemy reinforcements through a
combination of their bodies and any daze they might inflict. WJC
worshippers can deploy these mushrooms even more flexibly and
Fedhas-worshippers can shoot through them.

It should hopefully be a more exciting roll than Maw was on a shapeshifter
start (while also not having the awkward property of being better later in
the game).

--------------------------

Spore form player doll, talismans, and burstshroom tiles were made by
regret-index, using CC0 fungi units made by Blarumyrran, CC0 mushroom dogs
commissioned by Screen Smith Studios released to the public domain, and
CC0 robot assets made by Emcee Flesher. The felid form tile combines each
of these with the statue felid tile made by Sastreii and the vampire felid
tile made by LemurRobot.

Replace Blade Hands with Eel Hands, rework Blade talisman for 17 skill

Blade hands was left largely untouched by 0.33's talisman changes (meaning
largely unchanged since many versions before that). It may not have seemed
particularly bad on paper, but given its relatively low rate of use, I
think that what it offered (ie: 'higher single-target UC damage in
exchange for worse defenses') was not really what most UC characters in
midgame were looking for. When it was a form a background started with,
this was less true, but there are good odds of a player having access to a
multitude of other more appealing forms by the time they find a blade
talisman.

So this commit adds a new form to replace its position of 'mid-tier
UC-only talisman that melds few slots' while repurposing the talisman's
theme for a replacement to Maw's old role as 'quick blade aux synergy' at
an even higher tier.

Blade form (now 17 min skill) now causes blades to grow out of many
*other* parts of one's body instead of their hands, providing a pair of
moderate damage auxes and also a parrying bonus (like the glove ego) that
is directly increased by any source of slaying one has. It retains the
base body AC penalty the form currently has. This should be stronger in
its role of 'turn a quick blade into a blender' than maw form currently
is, but hopefully better-balanced by taking more skill to attain
(especially when combined with the quick blade mindelay change). (It might
also make the high blade talisman chance in the Hall of Blades actually
matter to anyone...)

And at 12 min skill there is Eel Hands, which is... approximately what it
says on the tin. This melds the same things that blade hands did, provides
rElec, a smaller UC base damage improvement, and gives your melee strikes
a chance of performing a mini-arcjolt (striking between 3-6 connected
targets at random). When brought to 50% of your max HP or below, they will
unleash a full-size arcjolt instead (with double the base damage of their
melee strikes). This should hopefully be a bit more interesting than Just
More Damage and who *hasn't* wished they could replace their hands with
eels? Well, the future is here now.

----------------------------

Eel hands form and talisman tiles, as well as adjustments to blade form
and talisman tiles, were done by regret-index. The eel talisman uses
Denzi's old Aizul tile and unused Trident of the Octopus King tile by
roctavian, while the default form tiles use an unused Spellbinder player
doll tile. The felid form tile separately combines Sastreii's dragon felid
tile with tentacles from a rejected tentacled monstrosity tile by
roctavian.

Blade form tiles were made using Denzi's original blade hands tile,
ontoclasm's felid and octopode blade tiles, and Sastreii's current blade
talisman. The felid form tile also combines these with roctavian's old
black bear tile.

Rework Maw form

Maw form provided a very strong boost to the direct damage of fast attacks
(short blades in particular) for relatively little investment or downside.
There were arguments that it flattened short blade gameplay by making it
too easy to increase one's direct damage to the point where one could
ignore some of the more unique ways that short blade gameplay theoretically
differs from other weapons (ie: stealth/stabbing).

On top of that, it was also not particularly good as a roll from protean
talisman in the earlygame, providing less upfront power compared to other
options.

As part of a group of changes, this moves maw back to 12 skill, gives it a
more impactful (and hopefully interesting) downside, makes its power a bit
more equitable between weapon types, and alters its healing mechanics.

-Maw's bite is now aut-normalized, attacking once per 15 aut on average.
-Maw's base damage is lower, but also directly increased by 3/4th of the
 player's strength.
-Instead of a direct healing effect (with some... rather unusual math
 involved...), all eligible melee kills in Maw form now provide a short
 duration of greatly accellerated regeneration. This works out to a fair
 bit more healing on average than before (but less rapidly, especially if
 killing multiple enemies quickly.) and with a more intuitive scaling from
 shapeshifting skill.
-The 'chance of growl on spotting an edible monster' now also mesmerises
 the player briefly. Unlike the Obsidian Axe, this is not a permanent
 effect, and won't immediately snap to another monster when that one is
 killed, so it shouldn't be too awful, but should provide a relevant and
 distinct downside that doesn't rely on melding gear.

Overall, this talisman should still fit the role of 'give more melee damage
to any weapon and provide healing on kills' while having a somewhat wider
range of characters interested in using it and more equitable up/downsides.
(I realize that 'wants high strength, yet penalizes heavy armour the most'
may sound contradictory, but my hope is that this provides a natural
counterbalance to maximizing value from this form, and opens up the door
for some less conventional combinations.)

Handle player regen before durations are decremented for the turn

This meant that statuses which increase the player's regeneration (like
Trog's Hand or rollpage) could expire without doing anything at all that
turn - especially if the player was taking slow actions.

This is a pretty small deal most of the time, but a subsequent commit will
add a very short-duration regen effect where this could often eat up the
majority of it.

I cannot see any clear reason why things were handled in this order, or any
other negative consequence that might happen by reordering them, but I may
be wrong.

(I also took the time to tidy some code into _decrement_durations() which
specifically had been left out since they *had* to happen after regen.)
